title: حَتَّى وَأَحْكَامُهَا
titleEn: The Particle Hatta and Its Rules
description: Learn about the particle حتى and its various grammatical functions: as a preposition (حرف جر), a conjunction (حرف عطف), and as a particle that introduces the subjunctive mood (حرف نصب).

notes.title: Introduction to حتى
content: حتى is one of the most versatile particles in Arabic grammar. It can function in three main ways: as a preposition (حرف جر), as a coordinating conjunction (حرف عطف), and as a particle that causes the following verb to be in the subjunctive mood.
The meaning of حتى is typically 'until,' 'even,' or 'so that,' depending on its grammatical function in the sentence.
Understanding حتى is essential for reading classical Arabic texts, as it appears frequently in the Quran, hadith, and Arabic literature.
keyPoints: حتى has three main grammatical functions
Its core meanings are 'until,' 'even,' and 'so that'
The following word determines its function
It is frequently used in classical Arabic texts

examples.english: It is peace until the emergence of dawn
I ate the fish, even its head
I walked so that I may enter the city

notes.title: حتى as a Preposition (حرف جر)
content: When حتى is followed by a noun, it functions as a preposition (حرف جر) meaning 'until' or 'up to.' The noun after it is in the genitive case (مجرور).
In this function, حتى indicates the end point or limit of an action. The noun following it must be either the end point of what preceded or part of a whole mentioned earlier.
This usage is common in temporal expressions and when describing the extent or limit of an action.
keyPoints: حتى الجارة is followed by a noun in the genitive case
The noun must be a logical endpoint
Common in temporal and extent expressions

examples.english: It is peace until the emergence of dawn
I read the book until its end

notes.title: حتى as a Conjunction (حرف عطف)
content: When حتى connects a noun to a preceding noun of the same type, it functions as a coordinating conjunction (حرف عطف) meaning 'even' or 'including.'
In this function, the noun after حتى takes the same case as the noun before it. The noun after حتى must be part of the preceding whole and typically represents an extreme (highest or lowest).
This usage emphasizes that even the extreme member of a group is included in the statement.
keyPoints: The second noun takes the same case as the first
The second noun is typically an extreme example

examples.english: I ate the fish, even its head
The people came, even their servant
I read the books, even the small ones

notes.title: حتى with Verbs (الناصبة والابتدائية)
content: When حتى is followed by a present tense verb, it can either cause the verb to be in the subjunctive mood (منصوب) or be followed by a verb in the indicative (مرفوع).
If حتى means 'so that' or 'in order to' (للتعليل) or indicates a future endpoint, the verb is subjunctive: سِرْتُ حَتَّى أَدْخُلَ (I walked so that I may enter).
If حتى introduces a result or explains what happened (للتعليل أو الغاية المتحققة), it can be ابتدائية and the verb is indicative: سِرْتُ حَتَّى أَدْخُلُ (I walked until I was entering).
The Quran contains examples of both usages, requiring careful analysis of context to determine the function.
keyPoints: حتى الناصبة: causes subjunctive, means 'so that' or future 'until'
حتى الابتدائية: followed by indicative, introduces result
With subjunctive: أَنْ is implied (حَتَّى أَنْ يَفْعَلَ)
Context determines whether حتى causes subjunctive or not

examples.arabic: وَكُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا حَتَّى يَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُمُ الْخَيْطُ الْأَبْيَضُ (البقرة: ١٨٧)
examples.english: Eat and drink until the white thread becomes distinct (subjunctive)
And they were shaken until the Messenger said (indicative reading)
I walked so that I may enter the city (subjunctive)
He became so sick that they had no hope for him (subjunctive)

exercises.promptEn: It is peace until the _____ of dawn
I ate the fish, even its _____
I walked so that I may _____ the city

exercises.prompt: I read the book until its end

exercises.answer: hatta as a preposition (followed by genitive noun)
